summary: An urgent email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Jack Goldberger regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case, noting that a minor victim was omitted from a list and requesting a signed notification to begin distribution to victims.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Addressed in an urgent email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the omission of a minor victim from a list in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The case referenced in the email involves Jeffrey Epstein, with the communication focusing on victim notifications.

connections.description: Goldberger is involved in legal communications regarding the Epstein case, specifically concerning victim notifications.

events.title: Urgent email regarding victim list omission
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Jack Goldberger to report that a minor victim was omitted from an identified victim list in the Epstein case and requests a signed notification to proceed with distribution.

keyFacts: The document is an urgent email dated July 7, 2008, concerning the Jeffrey Epstein case.
It reveals that a minor victim was omitted from a list of identified victims, indicating ongoing victim identification efforts.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney requests a signed notification to begin distributing notifications to victims, highlighting procedural steps in the case.
